document.docAuthor: Wang, Hanping, Wang, Lizhi & Li, Xiaochen
document.docTitle: Doryphoribius huangguoshuensis Wang, Wang & Li, 2007, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Tardigrades from Guizhou Province (China) with description of a new species of genus Doryphoribius (Tardigrada: Hypsibiidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Tardigrades from Guizhou Province (China) with description of a new species of genus Doryphoribius (Tardigrada: Hypsibiidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. Holotype (Slide number GZ0707001), nine paratypes (Slide numbers GZ0707002– 10 ) were collected from the Huangguoshu Fall (
25 °59.6’ N
,
105 °40.2’ E
) at 1,000 m above the sea level. All specimens are deposited at the Department of Life Sciences, Shaanxi Institute of Education, China .

Description. Medium size. Colour light orange. Eyespots present. Dorsal side with gibbosities arranged in 9 transverse rows, four gibbosities in each of the first seven rows and two in rows 8 and 9 (configuration 4, 4 , 4, 4 , 4, 4 , 4, 2 , 2 ). Internal gibbosities in row 2, 4 , 5 and 7 are in contact with each other. External gibbosities in row 2, 6 and 7 arranged dorsolaterally (
Fig. 1 A
,
Fig. 2 A
). Gibbosities’ diameters vary from 12.0 to 28.0. Cuticle, including gibbosities, with reticular design (
Fig. 1 C
), similar to reticular design of
Isohypsibius sattleri (Richters, 1902 )
. Meshes of this design irregular in size and shape with diameter varying from 2.0 to 5.0. Fine granules present along the lines of reticular structure.

Bucco-pharyngeal apparatus of
Doryphoribius
type . Mouth without peribuccal lamellae. Stylet furcae with the posterior-lateral vertices rounded and swollen. Buccal tube rigid with ventral lamina. Pharynx almost round with apophyses and two short, rod-shaped macroplacoids. First macroplacoid with constriction in middle, second macroplacoid shorter and without constriction. Microplacoid and septulum absent (
Fig. 1 D
,
Fig. 2 B
).

Claws of
Isohypsibius
type increasing in size from legs I to IV (
Fig. 1 B
). Very small accessory points present on the primary branches of claws. Smooth lunules present at the base of the claws on all legs but better developed on legs IV (
Fig. 1 E–F
,
Fig. 2 C–D
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1. A–F,
Doryphoribius huangguoshuensis
sp. nov.
(holotype): A, habitus focused to show gibbosities; B, habitus focused to show the claws; C, cuticular sculpture; D, bucco-pharyngeal apparatus; E, claws on the second pair of legs; F, claws on the fourth pair of legs (paratype, slide number GZ0707005). (A–F: phase contrast). A–B, scale bars = 40μm; C–F, scale bars = 10μm.

TABLE 1. Measurements [in µm] and pt values of selected morphological structures of specimens of
Doryphoribius huangguoshuensis
sp. nov.
(numbers in brackets represent the number of measured specimens).

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks. The paratypes are similar to the holotype as regards the qualitative characters.
Etymology. The specific name refers to the type locality (the Huangguoshu Fall).

Differential diagnosis. This new species differs from other species of the genus
Doryphoribius
with gibbosities mainly by different configuration of gibbosities and reticular design. It differs from
D. dupliglobulatus Ito, 1995
, besides the different number and arrangement of gibbosities (configuration 4, 4 , 4, 4 , 4, 4 , 4, 2 , 2 in the new species and 2, 2 , 2, 2 , 2, 2 , 2 in
D. dupliglobulatus
), in having eyespots and lunules. It differs from D. zyxiglobius (Horning, Schuster & Grigarick, 1978 ) in having lunules, and in having different configuration of gibbosities (configuration 4, 4 , 4, 4 , 4, 4 , 4, 2 , 2 in new species and 6, 4 , 6, 4 , 6, 4 , 4, 2 in
D. zyxiglobus
). It differs from
D. gibber Beasley & Pilato, 1987
, in having different configuration of gibbosities (configuration 4, 4 , 4, 4 , 4, 4 , 4, 2 , 2 in the new species and 4, 4 , 4, 4 , 4, 4 , 4, 2 , 2, 3 in
D. gibber
), in having two macroplacoids, and in presence of lunules at the base of claws.
